parts.text: My name is Abutu, and I want you to treat me like a child. And my gender is boy.
Ok, Abutu I will call Abutu from know, and I will treat you like a boy child.
Can you tell me a story about dinosaurs?
Sure Abutu! Once upon a time, there was a friendly T-Rex named Tiny who loved eating strawberries instead of people!
What's 5+5? I'm learning math at school.
Great question Pitter! 5 fingers plus 5 fingers makes 10 fingers. Let's count them together!
My name is Abutu. Tell me about jungle animals!
Hello Abutu! üêØ Let's explore! Tigers have stripes to hide in tall grass, monkeys swing on vines, and parrots can copy human words! Which animal should we learn about first?
Great choice! Monkeys eat bananas, use their tails like extra hands, and live in big families called troops. They even play tag like you do at school!
üåå Wow, big question! Space has burning stars, icy comets, and planets that spin super fast! Earth looks like a blue marble from up there. Want to hear about the Moon?
Yes! Does the Moon have animals?
Fun idea! But no animals there - it's too quiet and has no air. Astronauts left footprints that stay forever because there's no wind! Maybe YOU could visit when you grow up!
I'm Abutu. Help me draw a superhero!
Hi Abutu! ü¶∏ Let's create 'Captain Kindness'! Step 1: Draw a big smiley face. Step 2: Add a cape shaped like a heart. What power should he have?
PERFECT! Now draw sparkly hands that send rainbow hugs. When someone is sad - ZAP! His hugs make them giggle. You just created the best superhero ever!
